sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH DUE TO AN X1 FLARE AT 0445UT.  THIS EVENT APPEARS TO HAVE ORIGINATED FROM REGION 7205 (N11 L313), NOW TWO DAYS BEHIND WEST LIMB.  LOOPS WERE OBSERVED OVER THE WEST LIMB NEAR N11 AFTER THIS XRAY EVENT. M1 FLARES WITHOUT OPTICAL COUNTERPARTS WERE OBSERVED AT 0313UT AND 1353UT.  FOUR NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, REGIONS 7214 (S15W15), 7215 (S23E61), AND 7217 (N06E41) ARE SMALL SIMPLE GROUPS, WHILE REGION 7216 (N13E75) IS A LARGE H TYPE SPOT.  REGION 7216 MAY STILL HAVE TRAILERS BEHIND THE EAST LIMB.  IT IS THE BRIGHTEST REGION ON THE DISK.  SEVERAL SMALL FILAMENTS MAKING UP THE NORTH-SOUTH BOUNDARY OF THE LARGE SCALE MAGNETIC FIELD JUST WEST OF CM HAVE DISAPPEARED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  M CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 7216 AND CAN STILL BE OBSERVED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS FROM DEPARTED REGION 7205 IF IT PRODUCES ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE PROTON EVENT REMAINS IN PROGRESS. FLUXES WERE DECLINING UNTIL 1200UT WHEN LEVELS SHOWED A SMALL INCREASE, PROBABLY DUE TO THE X1 FLARE.  CURRENTLY, THE P10 FLUX IS ONCE AGAIN NEAR EVENT THRESHOLDS (10PFU).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  THE PROTON EVENT SHOULD END IN THE NEXT 12 HOURS.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. NEW REGION 7220 (S12E73) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE TODAY AT 2000Z. THIS NEW GROUP DOMINATED FLARE PRODUCTION TODAY WITH NUMEROUS C-CLASS FLARES, AND EXHIBITED BRIGHT PLAGE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. REGION 7216 (N14W08) CONTINUES AS THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK AND SHOWS SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY WITH A DELTA CONFIGURATION. NONETHELESS THE GROUP COULD ONLY MUSTER TWO SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON WEST LIMB TODAY AT S14: THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A C8 X-RAY EVENT.

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7220 (S12E63) PRODUCED 3 M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD: AN M1/SF AT 2212Z, AN M1/1N AT 2341Z AND AN M3/1F AT 0154Z. THE GROUP APPEARS TO BE A MODERATE SIZED (360 MILLIONTHS) E-TYPE GROUP WITH A SIMPLE BETA CONFIGURATION ALTHOUGH LIMB PROXIMITY MADE ANALYSIS DIF- FICULT. A 10 DEGREE SURGE AREA WAS REPORTED ON EAST LIMB BEHIND 7220, HINTING AT THE POSSIBLE EXISTENCE OF YET ANOTHER REGION TO COME. REGION 7216 (N14W20) CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK, BUT SHOWED DECAY AND LOST ITS DELTA CONFIGURATION. 7216 PRODUCED ONLY A COUPLE OF C-CLASS SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. AN ACTIVE PROMINENCE WAS NOTED ON WEST LIMB AT S17, EXTENDING JUST OVER .2 RADII BEYOND THE SOLAR LIMB.

sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE. REGION 7220 IS CONSIDERED TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY. REGION 7216 ALSO REMAINS RESPECTABLE AND COULD PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-EVENT AS WELL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7229 (N23W68) WAS THE MOST PRODUCTIVE REGION ON THE SUN TODAY WITH NUMEROUS SUB FLARES. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C1/SF AT 21/2345Z AND A C1/SF AT 22/0129Z. A PROMINENCE IN THE WEST SECTION OF 7229 ERUPTED AT 22/0523Z. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO DECAY AS IT NEARED THE WEST LIMB. REGION 7234 (S17W65) PRODUCED A 1F FLARE WITH NO ASSOCIATED X-RAYS AT 21/0203Z AND THREE OTHER SUB FLARES. REGION 7236 (N18W02), 7232 (N17W90), AND 7230 (S14W46) EACH PRODUCED A SINGLE SUB FLARE. REGION 7237 (N06W36) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 7229 AND 7236. BOTH HAVE A VERY SMALL CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS OWING TO A FAVORABLY POSTIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH ISOLATED PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7248 (S12E66) PRO- DUCED MOST OF TODAY'S FREQUENT C-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY INCLUDING THE LARGEST EVENT: A C7/SN AT 1939Z. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED A C1/SN AT 1431Z WHICH LED TO A BRIGHT SURGE BEING VISIBLE BEYOND THE SOLAR LIMB. REGION 7241 (N13W22) SHOWED NEW GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT TODAY IN A REVERSE POLARITY CONFIGURATION: THE GROUP PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 7242 (N18W07) ALSO SHOWED NEW GROWTH AND PRODUCED SOME SMALL FLARES.

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. REGION 7248 IS EXPECTED TO DOMINATE ACTIVITY WITH OCCASIONAL CONTRIBUTIONS FROM 7241 AND 7242. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7248 (S12E53) WAS THE SITE OF THREE M-CLASS EVENTS. THE FLARES WERE AN M1/0F AT 02/2303Z, AN M4/1N AT 0706Z, AND AN M2/1N TENFLARE (130 SFU AT 10 CM) AT 1014Z. THIS REGION, EMBEDDED IN A FIELD OF OLD PLAGE, IS DOMINATED BY TWO LARGE SPOTS. MOST FLARES OCCURRED IN THE EASTERN HALF OF THE REGION WHERE A DELTA CONFIGURATION MAY EXIST. ELSEWHERE, A PROMINENCE SITUATED AT N12E90 ERUPTED, BEGINNING AT 1406Z AND LASTING FOR ALMOST 3 HOURS.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7248 (S12E28) AND NEARBY REGION 7251 (S18E26) COMBINED FOR MOST OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY. THE LARGEST FLARE WAS A C2/SN FROM 7251 AT 1501Z. THIS COMPLEX REMAINS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AND APPEARS CAPABLE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7248 HAS SHOWN SOME GROWTH OVERNIGHT AND STILL SEEMS CAPABLE OF AT LEAST MODERATE ACTIVITY. X-RAY IMAGES SUGGEST THAT THERE IS AN INTERACTION BETWEEN REGIONS 7248 AND 7251 WHICH MAY PROVE FLARE PRODUCTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 17 NANOTESLA WAS RECORDED AT BOULDER AT 0024Z. MINOR STORM LEVELS FOLLOWED AND CONTINUED UNTIL ABOUT 1200Z. A DISAPPEARING FILAMENT FROM THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT ON 01 AUGUST IS BELIEVED TO BE THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED TO BEGIN THE PERIOD. BY DAY THREE EFFECTS FROM A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE ARE POSSIBLE AND CONDITIONS MAY INCREASE TO ACTIVE LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7248 (S12E15) PRODUCED SEVERAL LOW C-CLASS FLARES. THE DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THIS REGION FADED. REGION 7251 (S18E15) PRODUCED THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD - A C5/SN AT 05/2129Z. MAGNETICALLY, THESE TWO REGIONS ARE INTERTWINED AND MANY FLARES ARE "SHARED." A SMALL REGION EMERGED AT N19W23 AND WAS NUMBERED AS 7253.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BECOME
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7248 IS OVERDUE FOR A SMALL CLASS M FLARE IN SPITE OF THE DECAY IN THE AREA OF THE DELTA CONFIGURATION. A MAJOR FLARE FROM THE 7248/7251 COMPLEX REMAINS AS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED UNTIL A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 16 GAMMA OCCURRED AT 06/0427Z. AFTERWARD, ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS PREVAILED. TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD, MOSTLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED. A CONTINUATION OF THE PROTON ENHANCEMENT FINALLY PASSED EVENT THRESHOLD AT 06/1145Z. THE MAXIMUM FLUX OBSERVED WAS 14PFU (GT 10MEV) AT 06/1210Z. PROTON FLUXES HOVERED NEAR THE 10PFU LEVEL FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. A FORBUSH DECREASE BEGAN NEAR 06/0500Z AND REACHED A MAXIMUM OF APPROXIMATELY 7 PERCENT DURING THE DAY.  BELOW EVENT LEVEL POLAR CAP ABSORPTION ACCOMPANIED THE INCREASE IN PROTON FLUX ABOVE. MAXIMUM ABSORPTION WAS SLIGHTLY LESS THAN 1DB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR 07 AUG AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES. SIMILAR CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 08-09 AUG DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF A SMALL CORONAL HOLE. THE PROTON EVENT AND SUB-EVENT LEVEL POLAR CAP ABSORPTION SHOULD SLOWLY DECAY OVER THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7248 (S11E03) AND REGION 7251 (S17W02) CONTINUE TO DOMINATE C-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION. THE PEAK FLARE OF THE DAY WAS A C3/SN FROM REGION 7248/7251 COMPLEX AT 07/2101UT. THIS COMPLEX SEEMS TO BE DECAYING DURING THIS PERIOD. A LARGE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ALTHOUGH SLOWLY DECREASING IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY, REGION 7248/7251 COMPLEX STILL HAS POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AT HIGH LATITUDES THE FIELD RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN 06/1145Z ENDED AT 06/1650Z. LEVELS CONTINUE TO DECLINE TOWARD BACKGROUND TODAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS DUE TO A WELL POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. SEVERAL FILAMENT ERUPTIONS AND CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO THE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7248 (S12W11) SHOWED NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C6/SN AT 08/2011Z. REGION 7245 (S07W46) ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES WHILE DISPLAYING MODERATE GROWTH. NEW REGION 7257 (S20W45) EMERGED AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES, TWO OF WHICH REACHED C-CLASS. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7248 REMAINS CAPABLE OF ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7260 (N17W11), LARGE AND OMINOUS, HAD JUST C-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THE SUNSPOT GROUP MEASURES ABOUT 1000 MILLIONTHS IN WHITE LIGHT AREA, AND DISPLAYS A MIXTURE OF MAGNETIC POLARITIES AT VARIOUS POINTS WITHIN THE CLUSTER OF SPOTS. THE THREE OTHER SPOTTED REGIONS PALE BY COMPARISON AND HAVE BEEN LARGELY UNPRODUCTIVE. A LARGE DARK FILAMENT, CENTERED NEAR N45W15 AND SPANNING 30 DEGREES, DISAPPEARED IN THE EARLY HOURS OF THE DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7260 (N16W38) GREW TO A WHITE LIGHT AREA OF OVER 1400 MILLIONTHS AND PRODUCED ITS FIRST M-CLASS FLARES. THE ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF AN M2/1B AT 0921Z; AN M4/1B AT 1437Z; A MULTIPLE MAXIMA, LONG-LIVED M1/1B TENFLARE (240 SFU AT 2695 MHZ) WITH X-RAY MAXIMA AT 1729Z AND 1802Z; AND LASTLY AN M3/1B AT 2046Z. THE FLARES HAVE OCCURRED IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THIS ELONGATED GROUP WHERE SIGNIFICANT GROWTH HAS BEEN NOTED RECENTLY. THE REGION SEEMS TO RETAIN ITS POTENCY AND IS BY FAR THE DOMINANT FEATURE ON AN OTHERWISE DULL DISK. TODAY'S MARKED INCREASE IN THE 10.7 CM RADIO FLUX FURTHER ATTESTS TO THE DYNAMIC CHANGES IN REGION 7260.

sections.text: PERSIST AT MODERATE LEVELS DUE TO THE PRESENCE OF REGION 7260. STILL HIGHER LEVELS OF ACTIVITY ARE WITHIN ITS GRASP IF ADDITIONAL DYNAMIC GROWTH OCCURS.

sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7260 (N16W78) HAS DECAYED OVERNIGHT. MT WILSON NO LONGER SEES A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN IT. THE REGION FLARED TWICE AT THE C4 LEVEL DURING THE PERIOD AND PRODUCED THE DAY'S LARGEST FLARE, A C5 AT 23/2045Z.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7260 CONTINUES TO BE THE ONLY REGION WITH M-CLASS FLARE POTENTIAL ON THE DISK. IT ALSO HOLDS SLIGHT X-CLASS FLARE POTENTIAL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. MAJOR STORM PERIODS EXISTED FROM 2200-0900Z BEFORE THE FIELD QUIETED TO THE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE RANGE. A SERIES OF M-CLASS FLARES PERSISTED FOR ABOUT 12 HOURS ON 20 AUG, PERHAPS CAUSING TODAY'S STORM.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE THE FIRST DAY, THEN RETURN TO UNSETTLED FOR 25 AND 26 AUG.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE MOST INTERESTING EVENT OF THE PAST DAY WAS A LONG DURATION C1 FLARE THAT STARTED AT 28/2211Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM AT 29/0018Z, AND LASTED ABOUT SIX HOURS. THE SOLAR SOURCE OF THIS EVENT IS UNCLEAR BUT IT MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH FLARE ACTIVITY IN REGION 7268 (N04W67) OR EPL ACTIVITY AT THE EAST LIMB. NEW REGIONS 7269 (S18W42) AND 7270 (S09E65) WERE NUMBERED. REGION 7270 IS A SMALL SUNSPOT GROUP AND NOT PARTICULARLY ACTIVE. IT IS LOCATED JUST TO THE WEST OF OLD REGION 7248. X-RAY IMAGES SUGGEST THAT MORE SUNSPOTS MAY ROTATE INTO VIEW AT THIS LATITUDE WITHIN THE NEXT DAY OR SO.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THE CHANCE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY WILL INCREASE AS PREVIOUSLY ACTIVE LONGITUDES RETURN AT THE EAST LIMB.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE FIELD GRADUALLY BECAME DISTURBED AT ABOUT 29/0100Z AND RETURNED TO QUIET LEVELS BY 29/1800Z. THE CAUSE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS UNKNOWN.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.text: OBSERVED  AFR/AP 30 AUG  006/007 ESTIMATED AFR/AP 31 AUG  004/007 PREDICTED AFR/AP 01 SEP-03 SEP  005/007-010/010-020/025 BEGINNING SEPTEMBER 1992 SESC WILL BE INCLUDING A NEW PROBABILITY FORECAST FOR GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY IN ITS DAILY FORECAST. THERE WILL BE A NEW SECTION VI SPECIFYING THE PROBABILITY FOR ACTIVE, MINOR STORM, AND MAJOR/SEVERE STORM LEVELS (SEPARATELY FOR MIDDLE AND FOR HIGH LATITUDES). AN EXAMPLE FOLLOWS: VI. GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY PROBABILITIES 15 JUN - 17 JUN A. MIDDLE LATITUDES ACTIVE                       35/20/20 MINOR STORM                  05/05/01 MAJOR-SEVERE STORM           03/01/01 B. HIGH LATITUDES ACTIVE                       40/25/20 MINOR STORM                  10/10/05 MAJOR-SEVERE STORM           05/01/01  THE ACTIVITY LEVEL FOR THE DAY FOR THESE FORECASTS IS DETERMINED BY THE MAXIMUM K-INDEX (3 HOURLY PERIOD) OBSERVED DURING THE 24 HOUR PERIOD. CALL SESC FOR MORE DETAILS AND FOR INFORMATION ON HOW TO USE PROBABILISTIC FORECASTS. PHONE: (303) 497-5693/3171 FAX: (303) 497-3137 EMAIL: CBALCH@SELVAX.SEL.BLDRDOC.GOV

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7270 (S09W43) CONTINUED TO GROW AT A MODERATE RATE AND INCREASED ITS FLARE PRODUCTION. IT PRODUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 06/1852Z ASSOCIATED WITH A 420 SFU TENFLARE. NO SWEEP BURSTS WERE OBSERVED WITH THIS FLARE. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED ANOTHER X1/2B FLARE AT 06/2059Z WHICH WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. THIS FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 210 SFU TENFLARE. REGION 7270 ALSO PRODUCED 8 M-CLASS FLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M4/1N AT 06/1158Z. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON THE NE LIMB NEAR N19 AND WAS PROBABLY ASSOCIATED WITH THE EXPECTED RETURN OF OLD ACTIVE REGION 7260. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7270 (S10W83) PRODUCED THE DAY'S ONLY CORRELATED M-CLASS FLARE, AN M1/SF, AT 09/1803UT. AN M3 EVENT OCCURRED AT 09/0213UT, BUT NO ASSOCIATED OPTICAL FLARE WAS REPORTED. SUBFAINT FLARES WERE REPORTED IN REGION 7276 (N16E53) AND NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 7279 (S06E63). sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7276 IS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M CLASS FLARES AS IT DECAYS AND STILL HAS AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF AN X CLASS FLARE. REGION 7270 MAY STILL PRODUCE A MAJOR FLARE BEFORE IT IS COMPLETELY GONE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS BECAUSE OF FLARE ACTIVITY OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 52 NANOTESLAS WAS RECORDED AT 09/0139UT. A POSSIBLE FOREBUSH DECREASE BEGAN ABOUT 09/0130UT AND IS STILL DECREASING SLOWLY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS BECAUSE OF RECENT FLARE ACTIVITY, DECLINING TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY DAY TWO AND UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE END OF PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7276 (N15E26) SHOWED WEAK GROWTH AND PRODUCED AN M3/2B TENFLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP AT 10/2257UT. THIS REGION MAINTAINED ITS BETA-GAMMA CONFIGURATION AND IS THE BRIGHTEST REGION ON THE DISK, BUT HAS SHOWN VERY LITTLE AREA GROWTH OR DEVELOPMENT. AN UNCORRELATED M1 TENFLARE WITH A TYPE II SWEEP OCCURRED AT 11/0609UT. AN UNCORRELATED C1 EVENT AT 11/0108UT ALSO HAD A TYPE II SWEEP. THIS WAS POSSIBLY ASSOCIATED WITH A .25RV BSL ON THE SOUTH WEST LIMB.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. M CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 7276. THIS REGION ALSO HAS A SMALL CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED X CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. MAJOR STORM LEVELS WERE REACHED AT 11/0900UT. THE FOREBUSH DECREASE THAT BEGAN TWO DAYS AGO FINALLY ENDED AT APPROXIMATELY 11/1000UT. THE MAJOR GEOMAGNETIC STORM ENDED AT 11/1500UT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY EARLY ON 13 SEPTEMBER. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN ACTIVE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7301 (S16E12) WAS THE BEST FLARE PRODUCER WITH A C1/SF AT 04/0208UT, A C1/SN AT 04/0317, A PAIR OF B CLASS FLARES AND A SMALL SUB FLARE. THE REGION SHOWED SOME SLOW GROWTH. REGION 7303 (S13E17) SHOWED RAPID GROWTH TODAY AND PRODUCED A PAIR OF C1/SF FLARES, ONE AT 04/0342UT AND ONE AT 04/1603UT. REGION 7305 (N12E41) SHOWED ONLY MINOR GROWTH AND PRODUCED ONLY ONE SMALL SUB FLARE. REGION 7294 (S11W63), DECAYING SLOWLY, ALSO PRODUCED A PAIR OF MINOR SUB FLARES. REGION 7306 (S08E65) WAS NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 7301, 7303 AND 7305 ARE ALL EXPECTED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL C CLASS FLARES. REGIONS 7303 AND 7305 HAVE A SMALL CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED M CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7306 (S08E23) PRODUCED 4 M-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. ONLY TWO LOW LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED TODAY. REGION 7303 (S13W84) DISPLAYED SURGE ACTIVITY AND OCCASIONAL PLAGE FLUCTUATIONS AS IT NEARED WEST LIMB TRANSIT. REGION 7306 (S08W44) SHOWED CONSIDERABLE DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION TODAY, PARTICULARLY IN THE TRAILING SPOTS. ALL OF THE OTHER SOLAR REGIONS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY LOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M- CLASS EVENT FROM 7306 OR 7303 DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS. REGION 7303 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN M-FLARE DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WITH SOME ISOLATED SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE PERIOD BEGAN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS, BUT A GRADUAL ONSET OF ACTIVITY BEGAN AT 0745UT AND DEVELOPED INTO A BRIEF PERIOD OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE DISTURBANCE WAS SHORT LIVED, HOWEVER, AS CONDITIONS MARKEDLY DECLINED AND RETURNED TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FROM ABOUT 1600UT THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. AN INCREASE TO GENERALLY ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY AS A RESPONSE TO A CORONAL HOLE WHICH WILL BE ROTATING INTO A FAVORABLE POSITION AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TWO LONG DURATION FLARES OCCURRED TODAY: A C5 WITH MAXIMUM AT 1614Z AND A C7 WITH MAXIMUM AT 2021Z. THE C5 FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MODERATE TYPE II AND TYPE IV RADIO SWEEPS. NEITHER FLARE WAS WELL CORRELATED WITH OPTICAL FLARE REPORTS SUGGESTING A POSSIBLE BEHIND EAST LIMB SOURCE. THIS POSSIBILITY IS ALSO CONSISTENT WITH OBSERVATIONS OF LOOPS AND SURGE ACTIVITY REPORTED FROM N18E90. REGION 7306 (S08W59) CONTINUED TO DECAY TODAY AND WAS QUIET. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 7309 (S16W25), 7310 (N09E53) AND 7311 (S17E60).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. AN INCREASE IN BACKGROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED, HOWEVER, AS THE SUSPECTED REGION BEHIND THE EAST LIMB ROTATES INTO VIEW. THIS REGION TOGETHER WITH REGION 7306 PRESENT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL ABOUT 13/1500Z. A SMALL INCREASE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BEGAN AT THAT TIME AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS AT FORECAST ISSUE TIME. THE SOURCE OF THE INCREASE IS UNCERTAIN BUT THE LONG DURATION C8 FLARE WITH A TYPE II SWEEP THAT OCCURRED EARLY ON 11 OCTOBER LOOKS TO BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS AND SHOULD DECLINE TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FIRST DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BECOME MOSTLY ACTIVE ON THE SECOND DAY IN RESPONSE TO A CORONAL HOLE WHICH WILL BE FAVORABLY POSITIONED AT THAT TIME. ACTIVITY LEVELS SHOULD GRADUALLY DECLINE BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THERE WAS ONE C-CLASS EVENT RECORDED TODAY, A C9 AT 1935Z. THIS X-RAY EMISSION WAS THE RESULT OF AN EPL AT N12W90. MATERIAL FROM THE EPL WAS VISIBLE TO .16 SOLAR RADII. REGION 7306 (S08W71) CONTINUED TO DECAY AS IT NEARS WEST LIMB. TWO OTHER REGIONS, 7310 (N07E38) AND 7311 (S17E45) BOTH DISPLAYED SOME GROWTH OVERNIGHT. ONE NEW REGION WAS NUMBERED TODAY, 7312 AT N20E68.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. AT THE TIME OF THIS ISSUE THERE IS STILL NO INDICATION OF A STRONG REGION BEYOND EAST LIMB. PERHAPS YESTERDAY'S FLARES, LIKE TODAY'S, ORIGINATED FROM BEYOND WEST LIMB. sections.text: EXPECTED TO BECOME MOSTLY ACTIVE ON THE FIRST DAY DUE TO A SMALL CORONAL HOLE WHICH SHOULD BE IN A FAVORABLE POSITION AT THAT TIME. sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD ATTAINED ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVEL CONDITIONS EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND CONTINUING THROUGH ABOUT 1500Z. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7321 (S24W18) PRODUCED AN M4/2B FLARE AT 26/1816Z. MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS ACCOMPANIED THE FLARE. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW, BUT AT A REDUCED RATE. IT REMAINED STRUCTURALLY COMPLEX RETAINING TWO STRONG DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATIONS. REGION 7315 (NO7W74) WAS STABLE AS IT APPROACHED THE LIMB. REGION 7323 (S13E41) DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH WHILE PRODUCING A FEW SUBFLARES. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED NEAR S21W90 AT 26/1445. IT REACHED A VERTICAL EXTENT OF 0.14 SOLAR RADII. NEW REGIONS 7325 (S16E76), 7326 (S07E73), AND 7327 (N09W50) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7321 WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES AND MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7321 (S24W28) WAS TODAY'S BIG STORY. IT HAS DEVELOPED INTO A DKC, MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX SPOT GROUP WITH ALMOST 1300 MILLIONTHS COVERAGE. THIS REGION LEAD TODAY'S ACTIVITY WITH FOUR M-CLASS FLARES, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M1/1B AT 27/0741UT. IT ALSO PRODUCED A VARIETY OF C-CLASS AND SUB FAINT FLARES. REGION 7315 (N05W84) JOINED THE FRAY WITH THE DAY'S LARGEST FLARE, AN M3/2N FLARE AT 27/0700UT. ONE M-CLASS FLARE, AN M1, WAS UNCORRELATED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7321 HAS THE BEST CHANCE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS FLARES AND HAS A CHANCE FOR PRODUCING AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE. REGION 7315 STILL HAS A CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE BEFORE IT ROTATES OFF THE DISK.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7321 (S25W66) PRODUCED AN X1/2B LONG DURATION TENFLARE AT 30/1816UT. THIS WAS ACCOMPANIED BY AN IMPRESSIVE SURGE AND DISK LOOPS. THIS REGION SHOWED CONTINUED GROWTH AND REMAINS IMPRESSIVE AND COMPLEX. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED A VARIETY OF M-CLASS AND C-CLASS FLARES THROUGH THE PERIOD. TODAY'S 10.7 CM FLUX VALUE WAS SEVERELY ENHANCED BY THE X1/2B FLARE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7321 RETAINS GOOD M-CLASS POTENTIAL AND STILL HAS A CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE BEFORE IT ROTATES OFF THE WEST LIMB.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS SAW A SHORT PERIOD OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS. A PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 30/1920UT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE X1/2B FLARE. THE PROTON FLUX REACHED 460 PFU AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. MAJOR STORM LEVELS ARE EXPECTED AT THAT TIME DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF THE X1/2B FLARE THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. OCCASIONAL C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES, WITH NO OPTICAL COUNTERPART, WERE THE EXTENT OF THE DAY'S ACTIVITY. IT IS MOST LIKELY THAT MANY WERE RELATED TO THE SURGING AT WEST LIMB FROM REGION 7321 (S25W93). TWO NEW REGIONS, 7329 (S19E41) AND 7330 (S08E68) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THERE IS A CHANCE OF AN M-CLASS FLARE FROM NOW DEPARTED REGION 7321.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE ANTICIPATED SHOCK FROM THE RECENT X1/2B FLARE HAS YET TO PASS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT PERSISTS. A PEAK FLUX OF 2700 PFU OCCURRED AT 0710Z ON 31 OCT. IT HAS SINCE DECREASED TO 77 PFU AT THIS WRITING. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT ALSO REMAINS IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THIS PREDICTION IS ASSUMING THE SHOCK AND CME FROM THE PROTON FLARE OF 30 OCT ARE STILL IN TRANSIT. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD END THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7321, NOW MORE THAN A DAY BEYOND WEST LIMB AT S25, GENERATED AN X9 TENFLARE (5000 SFU AT 2695 MHZ) AT 0308Z. THE EVENT ALSO INCLUDED TYPES II AND IV SWEEP AND BRIGHT LOOPS VISIBLE FOR MANY HOURS AFTER THE X-RAY MAXIMUM. ELSEWHERE, LITTLE ACTIVITY OF NOTE OCCURRED ON THE VISIBLE DISK, WHERE SEVEN UNIMPRESSIVE REGIONS REMAIN.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 7323 (S15W54) AND 7330 (S08E58) OFFER THE BEST CHANCE OF FLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 7321 MAY PROVIDE YET ANOTHER PARTING SHOT FROM THE SOUTHWEST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD VARIED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE, MEASURING 60 NANOTESLA AT BOULDER, OCCURRED AT 01/2146Z. THIS SHOCK, LIKELY SPAWNED BY THE X1/2B FLARE OF 30 OCT, CAUSED BRIEF EPISODES OF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS, BUT, LACKING A SOUTHWARD IMF TO FOLLOW, A FULL BLOWN MAGNETIC STORM DID NOT SUBSEQUENTLY OCCUR. TODAY'S X9 FLARE CAUSED PROTON FLUXES TO RISE RAPIDLY, WITH A HARDER SPECTRUM THAN THE EVENT WHICH BEGAN LAST FRIDAY. THE GREATER THAN 100 MEV FLUXES PASSED THE 100 PFU THRESHOLD AT 0520Z, REACHED A MAX OF 120 PFU AT 0545Z, AND DROPPED BELOW EVENT LEVEL AT 0600Z. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV FLUX ACHIEVED A SECONDARY MAXIMUM IN THE ONGOING EVENT, REACHING 790 PFU AT 0550Z. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION IS STILL IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. A SIGNIFICANT GEOMAGNETIC RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X9 FLARE IS NOT ANTICIPATED. THE ENHANCED PROTON FLUXES SHOULD SLOWLY DECAY TO NOMINAL LEVELS OVER THE NEXT 24-48 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. CLOUDS HAVE HAMPERED PATROL OVER THE PAST DAY, BUT X-RAY DATA INDICATE LITTLE OF IMPORTANCE OCCURRING. JUST A FEW C-CLASS EVENTS WERE DETECTED AS THE OVERALL CHARACTER OF THE DISK HAS QUIETED SUBSTANTIALLY FROM THE ACTIVITY OF THE PAST FEW DAYS. SIX SPOT GROUPS ARE NOW VISIBLE WITH REGION 7330 (S07E43) THE MOST INTERESTING.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 7330 HAS THE BEST POTENTIAL FOR SMALL FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD VARIED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE MOST DISTURBED PERIODS OCCURRED IN NIGHTTIME SECTORS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT CONTINUES, BUT FLUXES SLOWLY DECLINED ALL DAY. THE CURRENT VALUE IS 46 PFU (2100Z), DOWN FROM A MAX OF 2700 PFU AT 31/0710Z, AND A SECONDARY MAX OF 790 PFU AT 02/0550Z. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT ENDED AT 03/1900Z. THE PEAK ABSORPTION AT THULE (30 MHZ) WAS 9.0 DB AT 31/1658Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SUBSTORMING IS LIKELY DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES WERE THE ORDER OF THE DAY. PERHAPS THE MOST INTERESTING OCCUR- RENCE OF THE PERIOD WAS THE RAPID EMERGENCE OF NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 7332 (S21W27). JUST A SINGLE SPOT 24 HOURS AGO, IT HAS GROWN TO BE 130 MILLIONTHS WITH MORE THAN 10 SPOTS NOW. IT WAS THE SITE OF AT LEAST ONE OF THE DAY'S FLARES. ELSEWHERE, A MODEST EPL WAS REPORTED NEAR N28 EAST LIMB ABOUT 1500Z, AND ONE OTHER NEW REGION, 7333 (N07E47) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. WATCH REGION 7332 AND REGION 7330 (S08E31), A GROWING REGION WITH BRIGHT PLAGE, FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE DURING THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD VARIED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS, A PATTERN REMINISCENT OF THE PAST FEW DAYS. HOWEVER, THE MOST DISTURBED INTERVALS TODAY WERE DURING LOCAL DAYLIGHT HOURS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT IS STILL IN PROGRESS. THE VALUE AT 2100Z WAS JUST ABOVE EVENT THRESHOLD, MEASURING 15 PFU.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. WEATHER INHIBITED OPTICAL PATROLS DURING THE PERIOD, BUT SPACEBORNE X-RAY INSTRUMENTS DETECTED AN IMPULSIVE M2 FLARE FROM AN UNKNOWN SOURCE AT 0622Z. MORE RECENTLY, A C8 FLARE HAD ITS MAXIMUM AT 2041Z. TWO NEW REGIONS HAVE BEEN SEEN AT EAST LIMB, 7334 (N12E69) AND 7335 (S17E75). BOTH ARE BRIGHT IN H-ALPHA AND SHOW PROMISE FOR FURTHER ACTIVITY. REGION 7330 (S08E18) HAS GROWN SLIGHTLY AND REGION 7332 (S21W41) SEEMS TO HAVE STABILIZED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT CONTINUES. CURRENT FLUXES ARE HOVERING NEAR THE 10 PFU THRESHOLD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. MOST OF TODAY'S LOW LEVEL FLARE ACTIVITY WAS FROM REGION 7334 (N13E60), A SMALL GROWING DAO SPOT GROUP. TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT WAS A C1/SF FLARE AT 1055Z. REGION 7330 (S08E03) CONTINUES AS THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK AT 450 MILLIONTHS AND SHOWS MODEST MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. NEVERTHELESS THE REGION COULD ONLY MUSTER A COUPLE SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. OBSERVATIONS ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB (AROUND S20) IN X-RAYS AND IN CALCIUM XV INDICATE SOME ACTIVITY MAY BE OCCURING BEHIND THE LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW, BUT WITH A CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. REGION 7330 SHOWS THE MOST POTENTIAL FOR PRODUCING AN M-CLASS EVENT. BACKGROUND LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY INCREASE AS THE INFERRED ACTIVE REGION BEHIND THE EAST LIMB ROTATES INTO VIEW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A PERIOD OF ACTIVE LEVELS WITH HIGH LATITUDE MINOR STORM LEVELS OCCURRED FROM 1200-1500Z. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN ON 30 OCTOBER ENDED TODAY AT 0010UT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. IS- OLATED ACTIVE PERIODS ARE POSSIBLE DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7332 (S23W68) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY C-CLASS FLARE: A C3/1F AT 1634Z. THE EVENT WAS UNUSUAL BECAUSE IT CAME FROM A MAGNETICALLY SIMPLE GROUP AND WAS MARKED BY PARALLEL RIBBONS AND BRIGHT SURGING OF MATER- IAL THAT COULD BE SEEN ON THE DISK AND SLIGHTLY BEYOND THE LIMB. A REVIEW OF THE EVENT SHOWED ASSOCIATION WITH THE DISRUPTION OF AN ACTIVE REGION FILAMENT OF 9 DEGREES EXTENT. REGION 7330 (S08W10) CONTINUES AS THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK AND SHOWED MODEST GROWTH TODAY, BUT WAS QUIET. REGIONS 7334 (N13E47) AND 7335 (S17E50) SHOW MATURE SPOTS AND RESPECTABLE SIZE BUT WERE STABLE. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND VOID OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW, BUT WITH A CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7330. A GRADUAL INCREASE IN THE BACKGROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED ON THE THIRD AND FOURTH DAYS AS OLD REGION 7315 (N06, L-130) WILL BE RETURNING AT THAT TIME. 7315 PRODUCED 3 M-CLASS FLARES DURING ITS PREVIOUS DISK TRANSIT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS. QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS DOMINATED MOST OF THE DAY BUT AN ACTIVE PERIOD OCCURRED AT MID-LATITUDES FROM 0900-1200UT AND AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 0600-1800UT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THERE MAY BE OCCASIONAL BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

THIS GROUP HAS SHOWN SOME GROWTH, INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A SMALL DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILERS. REGIONS 7334 (N13E32) AND 7335 (S17E37) CONTINUE TO BE MODERATE SIZED MATURE GROUPS BUT WERE STABLE. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7330 (S08W36) PRO- DUCED MOST OF TODAY'S LIMITED FLARE ACTIVITY INCLUDING THE LAR- GEST EVENT: A C2/SF AT 1732Z. THIS GROUP IS BEGINNING TO SHOW SOME DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION. REGION 7335 (S18E21) GREW DURING THE PERIOD AND DEVELOPED A SIMPLE DELTA IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THE REGION. THE GROUP NEVERTHELESS REMAINS STABLE AND ESSEN- TIALLY QUIET. REGION 7334 (N12E19) DEVELOPED SLOWLY DURING THE PERIOD BUT WAS STABLE. SURGING ACTIVITY AND AN ACTIVE PROMINENCE WERE OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT ABOUT S04. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7330 AND 7335 POSE A FAIR THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT SOME TIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. AN INITIALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FIELD PICKED UP TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM AT HIGH LATI- TUDES AROUND 0730Z. THIS ENHANCED PERIOD OF ACTIVITY CARRIED THROUGH WITH A GRADUAL DECLINE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. AT DAY'S END MID-LATITUDES WERE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AND HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS ARE POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE PERSISTS. CONDITIONS ON DAYS TWO AND THREE ARE EXPECTED TO BE ENHANCED DUE TO RECURRENT EFFECTS.

sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. NEW REGION 7345 (S23E72) PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES TWO OF WHICH REACHED C-CLASS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7348 (N13E61), A RAPIDLY GROWING DAO GROUP, LED THE WAY WITH AN M1/2N FLARE AT 22/2310UT. THIS REGION ALSO PROVIDED A VARIETY OF SMALLER FLARES INCLUDING A C5/1N FLARE AT 23/0854UT. REGION 7347 (S07 W25) ALSO HAD A NUMBER OF SMALLER FLARES, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C9/SN AT 23/0433UT. THIS REGION CONTINUED ITS GROWTH AS WELL. REGION 7342 (S08W90) JOINED THE FRAY WITH A NUMBER OF SUBFAINT FLARES INCLUDING A C4/SF AT 23/1359UT. AN M4 X-RAY EVENT, POSSIBLY CORRELATED WITH A SUBFAINT FLARE AND LIMB SURGE ON THE WEST LIMB IN REGION 7342, IS NOW IN PROGRESS. IT MAXED AT 23/2031UT. REGIONS 7349 (S05E58), 7350 (S19E68) AND 7351 (S15E72) WERE NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7347 AND 7348 HAVE THE BEST POTENTIAL FOR M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY. BOTH REGIONS ALSO HAVE A SMALL CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7351 (S15W05), A SIMPLE BXO SPOT GROUP, PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 1234Z. THE REGION HAS SINCE SIMPLIFIED TO A SPOTLESS PLAGE. PERHAPS A MORE INTERESTING EVENT PRECEDED THE M1 FLARE, THAT A LONG-DURATION C9 WITH TYPE II AT 0858Z. THE SOURCE OF THIS EVENT IS THOUGHT TO BE REGION 7345 (S25W89) WHERE POST-FLARE LOOPS WERE SEEN SHORTLY AFTER THE X-RAY MAXIMUM. THIS FLARE IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUXES WHICH STARTED TWO HOURS LATER.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 7348 (N12W16), STILL THE MOST IMPRESSIVE REGION IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA, COULD SUMMON AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE IF AN INSTABILITY SHOULD DEVELOP THERE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUXES BEGAN JUST BEFORE 1100Z AND REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 8 PFU AT 1520Z. FLUXES ARE SLOWLY DECLINING NOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7353 (S03E08), A SMALL AND UNIMPRESSIVE SPOT GROUP, PRODUCED AN IMPULSIVE M2/1N FLARE WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II AT 1929Z. THE REGION HAD DONE NOTHING TO INDICATE THIS LEVEL OF ACTIVITY PRIOR TO THE FLARE. IN FACT, THE SITE SHOWING THE MOST RESTRUCTURING AND GROWTH DURING THE INTERVAL WAS REGION 7352 (N20W27). IT INCREASED ITS WHITE LIGHT AREA BY 50 PERCENT AND NOW MAY CARRY A WEAK DELTA IN ITS INTERMEDIATE SPOTS. THIS GROUP HAD OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES IN CONCERT WITH ITS NEARBY NEIGHBOR, REGION 7348 (N12W29). ONE NEW REGION, 7354 (S23W51), WAS BORN ON THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. HOWEVER, WATCH REGIONS 7353, 7352, AND 7348 FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE OVER THE NEXT 72 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7352 (N20W41) PRODUCED MOST OF TODAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY INCLUDING THE ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/1N AT 1803Z. THIS GROUP SHOWED SOME DEVELOPMENT OF NEW SPOTS IN THE NORTHWEST LEADER PORTION AND SLIGHT DECAY IN THE CENTRAL SPOTS. THE REGION HAS MODEST MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AS WELL AND IS CLASSIFIED AS BETA-GAMMA. THE OTHER GROUPS ON THE DISK WERE RELATIVELY STABLE AND QUIET. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS REPORTED ON EAST LIMB AT S24, AND IS PROBABLY THE FIRST INDICATIONS OF THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7335.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY LOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M- CLASS EVENT SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. REGION 7352 IS CONSIDERED THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR SUCH AN EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS STARTED THE PERIOD BUT A MODEST DIS- TURBANCE BEGAN AROUND 09Z AND KEPT THE FIELD AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TOMORROW AND IS EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS. THE INCREASE IS EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TWO CLASS C2 FLARES OCCURRED - ONE AT 06/0032Z AND THE OTHER REACHED MAXIMUM NEAR 1920Z. THE LATTER EVENT BEGAN NEAR 1700Z AND WAS OF VERY LONG DURATION. NO UNAMBIGUOUS OPTICAL CORRELATION WAS RECEIVED FOR THE LONG DURATION EVENT. HOWEVER, AT THE END OF THE X-RAY ENHANCEMENT, OBSERVATORIES DID REPORT A WEAK LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM BECOMING VISIBLE AT NE09. ONLY A WEAK SPOTLESS REGION WAS VISIBLE AT THAT LOCATION LAST ROTATION. NEW REGION 7361 (S15W73) EMERGED AND GREW AT A MODERATE PACE. PLAGE IN THIS REGION WAS ALSO ENHANCED DURING THE LDE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A LOW LEVEL. IN SPITE OF THE LDE MENTIONED ABOVE, THERE ARE NO SIGNIFICANT REGIONS DUE TO RETURN. THE CURRENT DISK REGIONS DO NOT APPEAR CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ENERGETIC FLARES.

sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED ON 07 DEC BECOMING GENERALLY ACTIVE ON 08-09 DEC. DURING THIS PERIOD, SOME HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS MAY EXPERIENCE INTERVALS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS. THE SOURCE OF THIS FORECAST DISTURBANCE IS A TRANSEQUATORIAL LOBE OF THE SOUTHERN POLAR CORONAL HOLE WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE EXPANDED SIGNIFICANTLY SINCE LAST ROTATION.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C6 AT 07/1434Z. REGION 7361 (S14W85) CONTINUED TO EMERGE AND PRODUCED FREQUENT SUBFLARES. THE FIRST YOHKOH IMAGE RECEIVED SINCE 04 DEC REVEALED TWO REGIONS AT APPROXIMATELY N10E90 AND S09E90. THE NORTHERN REGION IS MORE EXTENSIVE AND IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THE C6 FLARE ABOVE AND THE LONG DURATION C2 FLARE NOTED ON 06 DEC. HOWEVER, NEITHER REGION IS INTENSE IN X-RAYS OR AT 10CM.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. THE NEW REGIONS AT THE EAST LIMB AND REGION 7361 COULD PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE BUT LIMB PROXIMITY PREVENTS ACCURATE ASSESSMENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET UNTIL NEAR 07/0900Z WHEN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS BEGAN. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS EXPERIENCED MAJOR STORMING BETWEEN 07/1300-1500Z. FOLLOWING THIS DISTURBANCE, THE FIELD RETURNED TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS MOST LIKELY THE TRANSEQUATORIAL LOBE OF THE SOUTHERN POLAR CORONAL HOLE NOW ABOUT 3 DAYS PAST CENTRAL MERIDIAN.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD CONTINUE AT GENERALLY ACTIVE LEVELS FOR 08-09 DEC. MINOR, TO BRIEF MAJOR, STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES ARE POSSIBLE DURING THIS INTERVAL. PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD OCCUR ON 10 DEC AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED HIGH SPEED SOLAR WIND STREAM LEAVES THE VICINITY OF THE EARTH.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  NEW REGION 7363 (S08E67) PRODUCED A C5/SF FLARE AT 1809Z, THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE DAY. REGION 7360 (S17E42) PRODUCED A C4/SF FLARE, AND THERE WERE THREE UNCORRELATED C-CLASS FLARES, POSSIBLY ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 7361 BEHIND THE WEST LIMB. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED: REGION 7363, REGION 7364 (N09E65), AND REGION 7365 (S21E12). NEW LEADER SPOTS EMERGED ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 7355 (S17W00), EXPANDING THE REGION FROM AN HAX TYPE TO A CAO.

sections.text: LOW.  REGION 7363 HAS THE BEST POTENTIAL OF PRODUCING AN M-CLASS FLARE, ALTHOUGH PRESENT PROBABILITY IS LOW.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, DUE TO A TRANS-EQUATORIAL EXTENSION OF THE SOUTHERN POLAR CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND MOSTLY UNSETTLED LATER ON, AS THE CORONAL HOLE MOVES OUT OF FAVORABLE POSITION.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. FLARE ACTIVITY WAS MINIMAL. REGION 7374 (S08E36) HAD THE BRUNT OF THE OCCASIONAL FLARES, AS IT EVOLVED TO HAVE A WEAK DELTA EMERGE IN THE INTERMEDIATE SPOTS. ITS BRIGHT PLAGE SUGGESTS THE POTENTIAL FOR HIGHER ACTIVITY. ELSEWHERE, SURGE AND PROMINENCE ACTIVITY WAS SEEN AT NE AND SE LIMB.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ANY M-CLASS ACTIVITY SHOULD ORIGINATE IN REGION 7374.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. ISOLATED SUBSTORMS MAY CONTINUE, WITH THE MOST PRONOUNCED EFFECTS SEEN AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7374 (S08E20) SLOWED IN ITS GROWTH AND EVOLUTION AND GENERATED BUT A FEW C-CLASS SUBFLARES. MAGNETIC DATA RECEIVED TODAY AGAIN INDICATE A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE INTERMEDIATE SPOTS. PROBABLY THE MOST NOTEWORTHY EVENT OF THE DAY WAS THE DISAPPEARANCE OF A 24 DEGREE-LONG FILAMENT IN THE EARLY HOURS OF 22 DECEMBER. THIS FILAMENT WAS LOCATED BETWEEN S20 AND S35 AT ABOUT MID-DISK. ONE NEW REGION WAS BORN ON THE DISK, 7380 (S15W45).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE IS POSSIBLE, PENDING FURTHER DEVELOPMENT IN REGION 7374.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS. EFFECTS OF THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENT OF EARLIER TODAY SHOULD BEGIN VERY LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7374 (S09E07) CONTINUED ITS SLOW DECLINE AS IT SIMPLIFIED IN BOTH WHITE LIGHT AND MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. IT GENERATED JUST TWO C-CLASS SUBFLARES. ELSEWHERE, SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY, ANOTHER SIZEABLE FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR CENTER DISK DISAPPEARED ABOUT 1200Z. THIS FILAMENT WAS ORIENTED NORTH-SOUTH AND SPANNED ABOUT 15 DEGREES. LITTLE ELSE OF SIGNIFICANCE WAS REPORTED. THE OTHER 7 SPOTTED REGIONS VISIBLE ARE DISTINCTLY COMMONPLACE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 7374 SEEMS CAPABLE OF JUST C-CLASS ACTIVITY. SIGNIFICANT DEVELOPMENT WOULD HAVE TO OCCUR FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS. CONDITIONS SHOULD THEN BECOME INCREASINGLY MORE DISTURBED THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD DUE TO EFFECTS OF THE LARGE CENTER-DISK FILAMENT WHICH DISAPPEARED EARLY 22 DECEMBER. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE FORECAST TO END THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7376 (N15W77) PRO- DUCED ALL OF TODAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY. THE LARGEST EVENT WAS A C5/SF AT 0939Z. TWO SMALLER FLARES WERE ACCOMPANIED BY WEAK TYPE II SWEEPS: A C1/SF AT 0248Z AND A C2/SF AT 0825Z. THIS GROUP CONTINUES TO SHOW GROWTH AND BRIGHT PLAGE BUT SEEMS TO HAVE A FAIRLY SIMPLE MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. REGION 7381 (N04W39) CONTINUED TO DECAY AND WAS STABLE. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS REPORTED ON EAST LIMB AT ABOUT S12.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. SOLAR BACKGROUND AND ACTIVITY LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE WITH THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 7376 FROM WEST LIMB ON 1 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOME BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7376 (N16W91) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE PAST DAY, AN M2/SN AT 31/ 0222Z. THIS REGION IS NOW AT THE WEST LIMB. REGION 7379 (S12W51) ALSO PRODUCED AN INTERESTING FLARE. IT WAS AN LDE PEAKING AT C6 AT 31/1941Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A DSF NEAR S05W49. NEW REGION 7386 (S04E84) WAS NUMBERED. IT IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7362, WHICH PRODUCED A FEW C-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. C-CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE IN REGIONS 7379 AND 7386. THE LIKELIHOOD OF M-CLASS FLARES SHOULD DIMINISH WITH THE EXIT OF REGION 7376.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE MOST PART. ACTIVE TO STORM CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT MANY STATIONS FROM 31/0900-1500Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED.
